intro: Steiropteris mexiae, commonly known as the Mexican tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its rhizome system supports the growth of the trunk and helps anchor the plant in moist, well-drained soil. Steiropteris mexiae plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
